document.docTitle: Robustagramma gigantisclerosum Cui and Marshall 2005, new species
document.masterDocTitle: Systematics of Robustagramma, a new genus of New World Sphaeroceridae (Diptera)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Systematics of Robustagramma, a new genus of New World Sphaeroceridae (Diptera)

heading.emphasis:
Robustagramma gigantisclerosum Cui and Marshall
, new species

subSubSection.paragraph:
As described for
Robustagramma biangulatum
except as follows.

Body length 1.4–2.0 mm. Eye height 2.5–2.6 times genal height. Maximum palpal width slightly longer than 1/5 of length of palpus; preapical palpal bristles ca . 1.5 times as long as maximum palpal width. Wing almost clear. Length of second costal sector ca . 0.46X length of third. Mid tibia of male with stout, short, ventral bristles on distal 2/3.

Male terminalia: Sternite 5 with 2 uniform rows of bristles posterolaterally, 2 or 3 inner pairs relatively short and thick. Whip­like sclerites of distiphallus with indistinct, node­ like structures. Ejaculatory apodeme exceptionally large, over 2/3 as long as aedeagal apodeme.
Female terminalia: Spermathecae with distal portion distinctly smaller than basal portion. Paired spermathecae with ducts ca . 1.9 times length of spermatheca.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 200–206.
Robustagramma gigantisclerosum
sp. nov. : 200, posterior view of male terminalia; 201, lateral view of male terminalia; 202, lateral view of male internal genitalia; 203, male sternite 5; 204, dorsal view of female terminalia; 205, ventral view of female terminalia; 206, spermathecae.

Etymology: The specific epithet refers to the large ejaculatory apodeme of the male, which distinguishes
Robustagramma gigantisclerosum
from all known congeners.
